title: Over 3,000 government schools have fewer than 10 teachers: Census Dept.
byline: More than 3,000 government schools across the island have fewer than 10 teachers, the Department of Census and Statistics has confirmed.

title: Man arrested at BIA with over 1kg of ‘Kush cannabis’
byline: An individual who attempted to smuggle in 1 kilogram of ‘Kush cannabis’ into the country has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Israeli strikes kill 20 in Gaza
byline: At least 20 Palestinians, including several children and a paramedic, have been killed and almost 40 others wounded in Israeli strikes in Gaza, hospitals say.

title: Exposition of sacred Devnimori relics begins at Gangaramaya
byline: The exposition of the sacred Devnimori relics of Lord Buddha is scheduled to begin at the Gangaramaya Temple today.

title: Showers above 75mm expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Hambantota district.

title: Iran-US nuclear talks to take place on Friday in Oman
byline: Nuclear talks between Iran and the United States will take place Friday in Oman, the Iranian foreign minister said, as tensions between the countries remain high following Tehran’s bloody crackdown on nationwide protests last month.

title: Ambuluwawa Cable Car Project will be allowed to resume if there is no environmental damage: Minister
byline: The Ambuluwawa Cable Car Project will be allowed to resume if it is confirmed that there is no environmental damage, Minister of Environment Dr. Dammika Patabendi has stated.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Effective use of foreign relief assistance deliberated by high-level committee
byline: The High-Level Committee for Foreign Relief Aid (Supplies) Coordination (HL-FRAC) has convened another session at the Parliament Complex under the chairmanship of the Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd).

title: Man sentenced to life in prison for 2024 attempt on Trump’s life
byline: Ryan Routh has been sentenced to life in prison for attempting to assassinate President Donald Trump on a Florida golf course in September of 2024.

title: Jeff Bezos’s Washington Post guts staff, shrinks news coverage
byline: The Washington Post, owned by Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos, began widespread layoffs on Wednesday that will drastically shrink the size of the storied newspaper and affect all departments, according to a recording of a company-wide call shared with Reuters.

title: Instagram down for more than 10,000 US users
byline: Meta Platforms’ Instagram was down for more than 10,000 users in the U.S. on Wednesday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.

title: Growing calls in India to restrict children’s social media use
byline: A debate around banning social media for children under 16 is gathering momentum in India, with ministers in several states saying they are studying a law that recently came into effect in Australia.

title: Court defers order in case against ex-Ministers Mahindananda and Nalin Fernando
byline: The Colombo High Court today (05) announced that the order on the preliminary objections in the case filed by the Attorney General against former ministers Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando, and retired Army Major General Nanda Mallawaarachchi, has been postponed until March 25.

title: Two arrested with over 57,000 smuggled cigarette sticks
byline: Two individuals have been arrested along with a stock of foreign cigarettes that were illegally brought into the country by air, police stated.

title: South Korea praises Sri Lankan workers, reaffirms support for economic cooperation
byline: The Deputy Speaker of the National Assembly of the Republic of Korea, Lee Hak-young has commended the significant contribution made by Sri Lankan workers to the Korean economy and expressed his gratitude to Sri Lanka for their service.

title: Pistol and cartridges seized in Dehiwala
byline: A pistol and three cartridges have been recovered from Waidya Road in Dehiwala, police stated.

title: ‘India, Sri Lanka share deep civilisational bonds’: PM on relics exposition
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today (05) said India and Sri Lanka are connected by “deep civilisational and spiritual bonds” as he thanked President Anura Kumara Dissanayake for inaugurating the exposition of the sacred Devnimori relics of Lord Buddha in Colombo.

title: Mattala Airport sees record passenger traffic in 2025
byline: The Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport has handled the highest number of passengers in its history during the year 2025, according to the Airport & Aviation Services Sri Lanka Private Ltd.

title: 48-year-old hacked to death in Colombo 13
byline: An individual has been hacked to death down Sri Kathiresan Street within the Aduruppu Street Police Division, Colombo.

title: Taylor Swift to debut ‘Opalite’ music video this week
byline: Taylor Swift has revealed that she plans to release the music video for “Opalite” later this week.

title: President to attend AI Impact Summit in India later this month
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to attend the India AI Impact Summit 2026 to be held in Delhi later this month.

title: Sri Lanka-World Bank review on-going development projects
byline: The Executive Director of the World Bank, Parameswaran Iyer and Sri Lankan officials have reviewed ongoing World Bank-supported initiatives, the Ministry of Finance said in a statement.

title: 9,000 Sri Lankans receiving treatment at 41 STD/AIDS clinics - Health Minister
byline: A total of 41 clinics are being conducted across Sri Lanka at present under the National STD/AIDS Control Programme, the Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: Australia police charge man with abuse of 459 children
byline: A man who “actively targeted” children on social media and gaming platforms has been charged with hundreds of child-abuse related offences against 459 victims in Australia and 15 other countries, Queensland police have said.

title: Samudika Jayaratne assumes duties as Sri Lanka’s first female Auditor General
byline: The newly appointed Auditor General of Sri Lanka, Samudika Jayaratne has officially assumed duties as the 42nd Auditor General of Sri Lanka at the National Audit Office today (05).

title: Indian HC denies reports of attack on SL fishermen by Indian Coast Guard on Jan. 29
byline: The High Commission of India in Colombo has denied the alleged assault on a group of Sri Lankan fishermen by the Indian Coast Guard on January 29, based on information it has gathered in relation to the incident.

title: Energy Minister reiterates pledge to slash electricity tariffs by 30% within three years
byline: Electricity tariffs will be reduced by 30% within the next three years, in line with the government’s promise, Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody stated in Parliament today (05).

title: National school teachers stage protest over suspension of children’s enrollment privileges
byline: A group of teachers and non-academic staff members of national schools across the country staged a protest today (05) near the main entrance of the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Devotees flock to Gangaramaya to pay homage to sacred Devnimori relics
byline: Hundreds of devotees have been flocking to Gangaramaya Temple in Hunupitiya since this morning (05) to pay homage to the sacred Devnimori relics of Lord Buddha, brought from India’s Gujarat state.

title: Bitcoin falls below $72,000 as market faces a crisis of faith
byline: Bitcoin briefly slumped below $72,000, a level last seen 15 months ago, as a broad risk-off move engulfed global markets.

title: Britain to work with Microsoft to build deepfake detection system
byline: Britain will work with Microsoft, academics and experts to develop a system to spot deepfake material online, the government said on Thursday, as it moves to set standards for tackling harmful and deceptive AI-generated content.

title: South Korean County governor’s proposal to import brides from Sri Lanka sparks controversy
byline: South Korea’s Jindo County Governor Kim Hee-soo came under fire after saying that “foreign young women from Sri Lanka or Vietnam should be imported” as a response to the issue of population decline.

title: Fears of new arms race as US-Russia nuclear weapons treaty expires
byline: The last nuclear weapons control treaty between the US and Russia has expired, raising fears of a new arms race.

title: New Auditor General takes oath of secrecy before Speaker
byline: The newly appointed Auditor General of Sri Lanka, Samudika Jayarathna, has taken the oath of secrecy before the Speaker of Parliament, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, in Parliament today (05).

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Leaked call exposes plans of criminal gangs operating from overseas
byline: Police have launched an investigation after an audio recording surfaced on social media, capturing a group phone conversation between four prominent underworld figures currently residing overseas discussing their future plans, criminal activities and drug trafficking.

title: Unauthorized constructions threaten Muthurajawela wetlands: Cardinal urges immediate action
byline: The Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith has urged the government to establish an institution named the Muthurajawela Development Authority to protect the Muthurajawela wetlands.

title: President to launch compensation, housing projects for Cyclone Ditwah victims in Kandy tomorrow
byline: The inauguration of a programme to construct new houses for families whose houses were destroyed or partially damaged by Cyclone Ditwah in the Kandy District, along with the distribution of compensation and the launch of several development projects, will be held tomorrow...

title: Digambaram claims estate workers facing obstacles to receive daily wage hike
byline: SJB Parliamentarian Palani Digambaram has raised concerns that plantation workers may not receive the recently announced daily wage increase of Rs. 400.

title: Gujarat Governor meets PM Harini to discuss Sacred Devnimori Relics exposition
byline: The Governor of Gujarat, Acharya Devvrat, together with the Deputy Chief Minister of Gujarat, Harsh Sanghvi, have met Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya today (05) at the Parliamentary Complex to discuss arrangements related to the exposition of the Sacred Devnimori Sarvagna Relics of Lord Buddha.

title: CID reveals new details on female lawyer arrested over ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court of several key facts uncovered in connection with Attorney-at-law Thamara Kumari Abeyratne, who has been arrested and detained on suspicion of aiding and abetting the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’.

title: Seven-year-old dies after cement plaster falls from apartment building in Modara
byline: A seven-year-old child has died after a section of cement plaster from the outer wall of an apartment complex fell on his head in the Madampitiya area of Modara in Colombo.

title: India-US trade deal, with 18% reciprocal tariff, to be signed by Mid-March
byline: The India-US trade deal - which will see the United States slash reciprocal tariffs to 18 per cent and India stop buying oil from Russia, while also commit to buying US$500 billion in energy and tech products from America - will be signed by mid-March, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said Thursday.

title: Nigeria deploys troops after 170 killed in deadly Kwara village attack
byline: Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu has deployed an army battalion to Kaiama district in the central Kwara state after suspected jihadist fighters killed 170 people in an overnight attack, his office said on Thursday.

title: Woman arrested over fake foreign employment agency, 154 passports seized
byline: A woman has been arrested for operating a fraudulent foreign employment agency and recruiting individuals for employment in Dubai, Romania, and several Middle Eastern countries, according to the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE).

title: US, Russia to reestablish military-to-military talks
byline: The U.S. military said that Washington and Moscow on Thursday agreed to reestablish high level military-to-military dialogue, following talks in Abu Dhabi, a move which could signal a move towards normalizing some ties between the United States and Russia.

title: India hands over 10 more Bailey Bridges for Sri Lanka’s post-cyclone recovery
byline: As part of ongoing reconstruction efforts following Cyclone Ditwah, India has dispatched a consignment of 10 Bailey Bridges to Sri Lanka to support the restoration of critical connectivity infrastructure in affected areas.
